document.full_text: motor vehicle crash-related deaths, the leading killer of children, teens and young adults, cost an estimated $41 billion in medical and work loss expenses in a year, a study showed on wednesday.
document.title: study: $41 billion yearly losses due to crash-related deaths
lines_and_colors: motor vehicle crash-related deaths, the leading killer of children, teens and young adults, cost an estimated $41 billion in medical and work loss expenses in a year, a study showed on wednesday.
